metadata.focus: Common outpatient diagnoses - primary care, urgent care, specialist visits

J06.9.plainLanguage: Common cold or upper respiratory infection - a viral infection of the nose, throat, and sinuses.

J00.plainLanguage: The common cold - viral infection with runny nose, sneezing, and sore throat.

J01.90.plainLanguage: Sinus infection - inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain, congestion, and sometimes fever.

J02.9.plainLanguage: Sore throat - could be viral or bacterial.

J02.0.plainLanguage: Strep throat - bacterial infection causing severe sore throat, often with fever.

J03.90.plainLanguage: Tonsil infection - inflammation of the tonsils causing sore throat and difficulty swallowing.

J18.9.plainLanguage: Lung infection/pneumonia - infection in the lungs causing cough, fever, and breathing difficulties.

J20.9.plainLanguage: Chest cold/bronchitis - inflammation of the airways causing cough, often following a cold.

J40.description: Bronchitis, not specified as acute or chronic
J40.plainLanguage: Bronchitis - airway inflammation causing persistent cough.

J11.1.plainLanguage: The flu (influenza) - viral infection with fever, body aches, cough, and fatigue.

U07.1.plainLanguage: COVID-19 - coronavirus infection that can affect respiratory system and other organs.

N39.0.description: Urinary tract infection, site not specified
N39.0.plainLanguage: UTI (urinary tract infection) - bacterial infection causing painful or frequent urination.

N30.00.plainLanguage: Bladder infection - UTI specifically in the bladder, without blood in urine.

N30.01.plainLanguage: Bladder infection with blood in urine.

H66.90.plainLanguage: Middle ear infection - common in children, causes ear pain and sometimes fever.

H60.90.plainLanguage: Swimmer's ear - infection of the outer ear canal.

H10.9.plainLanguage: Pink eye - infection or inflammation of the eye's outer membrane.

A09.plainLanguage: Stomach flu/gastroenteritis - infection causing nausea, vomiting, diarrhea.

B00.9.plainLanguage: Herpes infection - can refer to cold sores or other herpes-related conditions.

B02.9.plainLanguage: Shingles - painful rash from reactivation of chickenpox virus.

E11.9.plainLanguage: Type 2 diabetes - the body doesn't use insulin properly, requiring diet/medication management.

E11.65.plainLanguage: Type 2 diabetes with high blood sugar at this visit.

E78.5.plainLanguage: High cholesterol - elevated fats in the blood.

I10.plainLanguage: High blood pressure - elevated pressure in arteries, usually without known cause.

E03.9.plainLanguage: Underactive thyroid - thyroid doesn't produce enough hormone, causing fatigue and weight gain.

E05.90.plainLanguage: Overactive thyroid - thyroid produces too much hormone.

E66.9.plainLanguage: Obesity - excess body weight that may affect health.

E66.01.description: Morbid (severe) obesity due to excess calories

J45.909.plainLanguage: Asthma - chronic lung condition causing breathing difficulties, wheezing, and coughing.

J44.9.plainLanguage: COPD - chronic lung disease causing airflow problems and breathing difficulties.

K21.0.plainLanguage: GERD/acid reflux with inflammation - stomach acid backing up into esophagus causing irritation.

K21.9.plainLanguage: GERD/acid reflux - stomach acid backing up causing heartburn.

M54.5.plainLanguage: Lower back pain - one of the most common complaints.

M54.50.plainLanguage: Lower back pain without specific identified cause.

M54.6.plainLanguage: Mid-back pain - pain in the middle portion of the spine.

M25.571.description: Pain in right ankle and foot

M25.572.description: Pain in left ankle and foot

M79.3.plainLanguage: Inflammation of fatty tissue under skin.

M62.830.plainLanguage: Back muscle spasm - involuntary tightening of back muscles.

M17.11.plainLanguage: Knee arthritis (wear-and-tear type) in right knee.

M17.12.plainLanguage: Knee arthritis (wear-and-tear type) in left knee.

M19.90.plainLanguage: Arthritis - joint wear and tear causing pain and stiffness.

M75.100.description: Unspecified rotator cuff tear, unspecified shoulder
M75.100.plainLanguage: Rotator cuff tear - damage to shoulder tendons.

M77.10.plainLanguage: Tennis elbow - pain on the outer elbow from overuse.

M72.2.plainLanguage: Heel pain from inflammation of the tissue on the bottom of the foot.

G56.00.description: Carpal tunnel syndrome, unspecified upper limb
G56.00.plainLanguage: Carpal tunnel - wrist nerve compression causing numbness and tingling in hand.

S93.401A.description: Sprain of unspecified ligament of right ankle, initial encounter
S93.401A.plainLanguage: Right ankle sprain - stretched or torn ligaments in the ankle.

S93.402A.description: Sprain of unspecified ligament of left ankle, initial encounter

S83.90XA.description: Sprain of unspecified site of unspecified knee, initial encounter
S83.90XA.plainLanguage: Knee sprain - ligament injury to the knee.

S13.4XXA.description: Sprain of ligaments of cervical spine, initial encounter
S13.4XXA.plainLanguage: Neck sprain/whiplash - ligament injury in the neck.

S39.012A.description: Strain of muscle, fascia and tendon of lower back, initial encounter
S39.012A.plainLanguage: Lower back strain - pulled muscle in the lower back.

S09.90XA.description: Unspecified injury of head, initial encounter
S09.90XA.plainLanguage: Head injury - general term for any head trauma.

S06.0X0A.description: Concussion without loss of consciousness, initial encounter

S62.90XA.description: Unspecified fracture of unspecified wrist and hand, initial encounter

S52.501A.description: Unspecified fracture of the lower end of right radius, initial encounter

S82.90XA.description: Unspecified fracture of unspecified lower leg, initial encounter

T14.8.description: Other injury of unspecified body region

W19.XXXA.plainLanguage: Fall - external cause code indicating the patient fell.

F41.1.plainLanguage: Generalized anxiety - persistent excessive worry affecting daily life.

F32.9.description: Major depressive disorder, single episode, unspecified

F33.9.plainLanguage: Recurrent depression - multiple episodes over time.

F90.9.plainLanguage: ADHD - difficulty with attention, hyperactivity, and/or impulsivity.

F43.10.plainLanguage: PTSD - mental health condition triggered by traumatic event.

G47.00.plainLanguage: Insomnia - difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep.

F51.01.plainLanguage: Primary insomnia - sleep problems not caused by another condition.

G43.909.plainLanguage: Migraine headache - severe headache often with nausea and light sensitivity.

R51.9.plainLanguage: Headache - general term when type is not specified.

G44.209.plainLanguage: Tension headache - common headache often caused by stress or muscle tension.

H81.10.description: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo, unspecified ear
H81.10.plainLanguage: BPPV - brief episodes of spinning sensation triggered by head movement.

R55.plainLanguage: Fainting/passing out - temporary loss of consciousness.

L30.9.plainLanguage: Skin inflammation/rash - general term for skin irritation.

L20.9.plainLanguage: Eczema - chronic skin condition causing itchy, red, inflamed skin.

L23.9.plainLanguage: Allergic skin reaction to contact with a substance.

L70.0.plainLanguage: Acne - common skin condition with pimples and blemishes.

L03.90.plainLanguage: Cellulitis - bacterial skin infection causing redness and swelling.

L02.91.plainLanguage: Skin abscess - collection of pus under the skin (boil).

B35.1.plainLanguage: Toenail fungus - fungal infection of the nails.

B35.3.plainLanguage: Athlete's foot - fungal infection between toes.

L50.9.plainLanguage: Hives - itchy, raised welts on the skin, often from allergic reaction.

L57.0.plainLanguage: Precancerous skin lesion - rough, scaly spot from sun damage.

K30.plainLanguage: Indigestion - stomach discomfort, bloating, or nausea.

R11.0.plainLanguage: Nausea - feeling sick to your stomach.

K57.30.description: Diverticulosis of large intestine without perforation or abscess
K57.30.plainLanguage: Diverticulosis - small pouches in the colon wall (common with age).

K58.9.plainLanguage: IBS - chronic condition causing abdominal pain and altered bowel habits.

R07.9.plainLanguage: Chest pain - requires evaluation to determine cause.

R00.2.plainLanguage: Awareness of heartbeat - feeling heart racing or fluttering.

R21.description: Rash and other nonspecific skin eruption

R22.9.description: Localized swelling, mass and lump, unspecified

Z00.00.description: Encounter for general adult medical examination without abnormal findings
Z00.00.plainLanguage: Routine physical exam - no problems found.

Z00.01.description: Encounter for general adult medical examination with abnormal findings
Z00.01.plainLanguage: Routine physical exam - some findings need attention.

Z00.121.description: Encounter for routine child health examination with abnormal findings
Z00.121.plainLanguage: Well child visit - some findings need attention.

Z00.129.description: Encounter for routine child health examination without abnormal findings

Z12.31.description: Encounter for screening mammogram for malignant neoplasm of breast

Z12.11.description: Encounter for screening for malignant neoplasm of colon

J30.1.plainLanguage: Hay fever - seasonal allergies to pollen.

L27.0.description: Generalized skin eruption due to drugs and medicaments
L27.0.plainLanguage: Drug rash - skin reaction to medication.

Z88.9.description: Allergy status to unspecified drugs, medicaments and biological substances
